content: I am impressed with the Pixel Fold so far, even if it feels like a minor update.
The Pixel Fold is shockingly good! I'm delighted by this thing it's refreshing to use.
Not just with the original Pixel Fold, but also with a few of the alternatives. It's a phone for everyone.
The Pixel Fold is brighter, faster and sturdier, but it comes with a premium price.
Is the latest foldable Pixel Fold worth the premium price? It is a more durable foldable.
The Pixel Fold is so much better than the first one, but is that enough?
The Pixel Fold is a big step into the unknown for Google, but it's unexpectedly amazing!
My video review of the Pixel Fold will take some time, hopefully sometime next week, because it looks great.
The Pixel Fold is hinging on innovation and is the ultimate Google phone.
The Pixel Fold has a familiar feel, but with smarter execution in its design.
The Pixel Fold is in great shape and is my favorite flawed foldable.
The Pixel Fold is a bit hard to recommend unless innovation is a priority.
The Pixel Fold gets it right, mostly, as an AI-powered foldable.
I want a Pixel Fold and Pixel Watch review, I am curious about the product.
The Casetify Pixel Fold case review shows the cases are adding some much needed protection.
The Pixel Fold is unexpectedly amazing, but you can hate it based on your needs.
The Pixel Fold review shows that durability and battery win out over sleekness.
I had some impressions when using the Pixel Fold, it's great with the Google's foldable design.
The Pixel Fold doesn't fear dust, it's a very resistant and well built foldable.
The Pixel Fold excels in design, but it falters in software compared to other foldables.
I want the review on the Pixel Fold to understand it's pros and cons before buying.
The Pixel Fold is a familiar package with AI, a good software leap and responsive screen transitions.
The Pixel Fold is a first-generation product. It's new in the mobile market.
I have found the worst mobile I have ever used in my life. Samsung has no R&D and poor quality hardware.
I should prefer Pixel Fold instead of Samsung foldables because I can't use glass on a folding phone.
Google's Pixel Fold is nice, but the wide outer screen still feels off. Overall, it's good but has its place.
The Pixel Fold was late and Pixel got Periscope zoom later. Google Pixel is the next big thing in the market.
Pixel Fold's concept is interesting, but Samsung's execution is better. Reviews say the same about Flip7.
I hate the size of the Pixel Fold, it's too chunky and heavy. Otherwise, I think it's a cool device.
I'm enjoying my new foldable phone. Pressing on the frame helps avoid putting pressure on the screen when closing it.
I like the Pixel Fold a lot, but it's delicate. Mine shattered after a small drop, but I love it otherwise.
My Fold charged slowly at first, but the charging speed seems faster after a month of use.
I just got the Pixel Fold, and I don't think I'll ever go back to a normal phone. It feels amazing.
I can't list Samsung software as a pro. It's the reason I can't use their phones for long.
I'm switching to the Pixel Fold if it doesn't have that annoying new update that looks like an Apple product.
My Pixel Fold's hinge mechanism is acting differently. It snaps when I open it, which feels strange.
I love my Pixel Fold and I'm using it caseless with a glow in the dark skin and a magsafe ring.
I have the same color Pixel Fold with a cover and an anti-reflective protective glass, which is exceptional.
I was looking to be deinfluenced. I have an S24 ultra and the specs seem the same.
I think Google's current implementation of the side fingerprint reader is smart and convenient to use.
Grab the Samsung it's a tablet. The reviewer is way wrong about the Pixel Fold durability.
The Pixel Fold's cost versus the Fold 7 isn't a good match in terms of deals in my opinion.
The camera looks terrible, so I don't feel so bad about cancelling my order. I'll wait for P11 Fold.
I tried out the Pixel Fold and couldn't find a reason to need such a big screen for my usage.
I owned the Pixel 9 Pro Fold and Z Fold 5. The Pixel felt like a prototype Samsung is the Apple.
Samsung's OS is complete garbage. Google's OS is far superior and stays out of my way.
I am waiting for comments on the thermals of the Pixel Fold and will wait for more reviews.
MKBHD's review was strange. He seemed disappointed even when talking about the phone's strengths.
My ZF4 started not unfolding flat after a few months. Since the Pixel Fold has no stylus, it's not an issue.
It seems like a great first attempt, but I can't get over the worse cameras and terrible battery.
The battery life is a no-go for me. I wish Google used Snapdragon chips for efficiency.
Thankfully I didn't preorder, I like pixels for software, camera and cheap price so maybe next year.
Battery life is a pain point. Tensor G2 has got to go, and G3 needs hefty efficiency gains.
He really likes the Pixel Fold. He likes the pros and the quirks, and it kind of fits that Pixel vibe.
These folding phones always look clunky and unrefined. I think we need another 3-5 years to get them right.
I'd rather get the 7 Pro and Pixel Tablet for YouTube, Reddit, and editing, instead of the Pixel Fold.
When I found out it was powered by the G2, I lost interest. Wait until next year for a better processor.
I figured the battery life would suck because the Tensor ship is terrible with battery usage.
The Pixel Fold should have come out 3 years ago. It doesn't learn from other manufacturers mistakes.
No desktop mode, poor battery, double screen not optimized, mid-range CPU, large bezel. Samsung Fold better.
The reviewer said he'll keep using this one though, which is an interesting way to end the review.
What is not compatible or missing on the Google Pixel Pro Fold? The video doesn't provide details.
Those bezels are still pretty horrendous. I have a feeling Jerry Rig will get dust in it instantly.
I switched to Android to get access to the latest AI experiments, and I love my first fold.
The P9PF is my 1st Pixel after being a Samsung user for over a decade. Biggest pro is getting updates first.
Why did you order Pixel 10 Pro Fold if you were happy with Pixel 9 Pro Fold? Please provide an honest insight.
Obviously I don't want to miss out on AI experiments and Google is a monopoly in that regard.
Worst phone I ever owned. Had issues and died after warranty expired. Never buying pixel again.
You had a foldable hardware defect on last year's model and you decided to get another one this year.
It's a better foldable phone. I am loving my P10PF and recommend it despite the haters.
I have both "North American" Foldable and both have perks and downfalls. "Best" is subjective to opinions.
The 10fold is better than zfold 7 is diabolical at this point, because it's not the best phone.
Mine did that exactly the same this week, so there must be a common problem with the design.
Dang, mine did this today. I am having to get a refurbished replacement from Google Support.
Is the Samsung Fold having this same issue? It makes me extremely nervous to own this phone.
Every morning that I wake up I get nervous checking my phone to see it is still working.
I haven't had any issues with my 9 Pro Fold. After dealing with Samsung I'll never buy Samsung again.
Mine just did the same thing, waiting to chat. This is clearly a defect with the phone.
I woke up this morning to the same issue with the screen... This phone was a tax return splurge.
I just had the same happen to my Pro Fold and am based in a country without Google Support.
